intro: Oxymitra macrophylla, commonly known as the giant oxymitra, is a striking member of the Araliaceae family native to the rainforests of Queensland, Australia. It is characterized by its large, broad leaves that can reach up to 30 cm in length, which are typically a deep green with a waxy texture. The plant produces clusters of small, white flowers that are followed by bright red berries, attracting various wildlife. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in the understorey of dense tropical forests. Due to its unique appearance and ecological significance, it is a notable species in botanical studies and conservation efforts.
